qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the M3-G and the M3-DL compasses?
qa_pair.answer: Global needle works anywhere on the planet on the "G." So, this one is for world-wide use since the magnetic field changes around the globe. The "D" is for declination  which is the amount the needle is deflected from a correct north based on your position. Good maps will show this so you can make adjustments to your compass.  So, "G" is for the special global needle which will not be confused outside the area it was intended to be used within.

qa_pair.question: How difficult is it for someone unfamiliar with using a compass to set the declination?
qa_pair.answer: The mechanism for changing the declination is simple as turning a small brass screw with the metal tab on the compass lanyard.  An internet search on declination makes finding the amt of declination for your location simple.  Just make sure you set it in the right direction!

qa_pair.question: How difficult is it for someone unfamiliar with using a compass to set the declination?
qa_pair.answer: Not hard to do and you might want to look up declination for hiking. Basically it is difference between true and magnetic north. You can get your declination by going to NOAA Geophysical DAta Center and putting in your zipcode. 0 declination runs from tip of Florida to Lake Superior. Depending whether you are east or west of that line, you add or subtract from the map's north.

qa_pair.question: How difficult is it for someone unfamiliar with using a compass to set the declination?
qa_pair.answer: So easy! There is a little screw on the back. The key comes with in. Check the declination of you region on the internet: http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag-web/#declination and set it in your compass.

qa_pair.question: How difficult is it for someone unfamiliar with using a compass to set the declination?
qa_pair.answer: It is very simple to set as long as the map you're using has that info listed.  I am VERY new to navigation with a compass, and was easily able to adjust it once I learn what it was to begin with!!

qa_pair.question: How is the ventilation with the door closed? Is there a way to get air through with it safely zipped?
qa_pair.answer: You may not have looked at inexpensive tents lately.  They are mesh under the fly these days.  They in reality are three season tents.

rewrite.edit: The inexpensive tents are mesh under the fly. They are basically 3 season tents now.
Tents these days have mesh under the fly for ventilation. They in reality are three season tents.
The ventilation is mesh. Air can safely get through while zipped.

qa_pair.question: How is the ventilation with the door closed? Is there a way to get air through with it safely zipped?
qa_pair.answer: There's no way *not* to get air in this tent.   Two of the four walls are mostly mesh, with a rainfly stretched over the top.  This tent is designed for warm or hot weather, and will not seal up tight to keep out the cold.  In my experience with two adults on a moderately cool night (mid 40s), this tent retained almost no heat inside.

qa_pair.question: How is the ventilation with the door closed? Is there a way to get air through with it safely zipped?
qa_pair.answer: These have good ventilation. Good for warm climates. The two sides are screen, but the fly keeps the rain out (and provides privacy).

qa_pair.question: Has anyone figured out how to get it back into the bag?
qa_pair.answer: To avoid weakening the tent fabric along fold lines used over and over, you should just stuff the tent into the stuff sack; never store a tent rolled up; ideally store the completely dry tent in a slightly larger stuff sack that allows a little air flow to avoid fabric compression and reduces the chance of mildew developing.

rewrite.edit: Stuff the tent into the stuff sack to avoid weakening the tent fabric along the fold lines. Never store a tent rolled up, instead store the dry tent in a larger stuff sack that allows some air flow to reduce mildew development.
Don't fold over tent fabric because it could weaken so just stuff into stuff sack that is dry to allow very little air flow to prevent mildew.
You can stuff the tent into the stuff sack but do not store it while rolled up. Ideally it should be completely dry and allows little airflow to avoid fabric compression and mildew.

qa_pair.question: Has anyone figured out how to get it back into the bag?
qa_pair.answer: I didn't have much problem getting it back into the bag.  Lay it out flat.  Then get the storage bag and lay it next to the tent so you can see the size it needs to be when folded.  Fold both sides of the tent in toward the middle until the width of the tent is a little less than the length of the storage bag.  Then roll it up very tight and it should fit into the bag.

qa_pair.question: Has anyone figured out how to get it back into the bag?

qa_pair.question: How do you fit 6 people in this tent? 10x10 is less than 2ft./person.
qa_pair.answer: Person ratings on tents are always horribly optimistic.  They're basically how many people you can theoretically fit if they're all average sized and packed in like sardines.  Yeah, you can fit 6 people in but they won't be moving around at all and will be packed edge to edge.  Realistically 4 is probably the most you'd want in any "6 person" tent.  I tend to just subtract 2 from any published capacity on a tent automatically.

qa_pair.question: if Blade Length is 7" and  Handle Length is 3" then how Overall Length is 12"?
qa_pair.answer: Handle length is actually about 3.6 inches, and the actual blade length is 7". The blade has about a half inch that has absolutely no edge before it even reaches the finger guard. But the overall measurement includes not just the blade and grip, but also the finger guard, and the butt of the hilt of the knife's grip. qa_pair.answer: I had them both. Solas had wider coverage (hotshot is really directional) but the solas only has one low setting and that is non - blinking.  The hotshot has an adjustable brightness. summary: This product is USB rechargeable and comes with a charging cord. The light is solid and can withstand some rain and water. The light flashes red and can be mounted with a buckle, strap, and a clip. This light doesn't come with a rack mount but it can be mounted and dismounted from the rear rack with a self-made rack. The light has a quick release that attaches to the seat post or seat stay bracket. Instead of those brackets, the light can be mounted or zip-tied to a rack. The dimensions of this light are 3x1.5x1.5. The charging port on this light is compatible with a micro USB cable.

qa_pair.question: Is this axe good for a survival tool or not?
qa_pair.answer: Yes it's a good survival  tool. Lightweight, ergonomic, sharp, and versatile. Comes with nice sharpening stone. Hammer end opposite the blade is very handy.

qa_pair.question: Is this axe good for a survival tool or not?
qa_pair.answer: Outdoor survival yes. Urban survival kind of. This tool, in my opinion, is a outstanding survival tool for woodland survival. For the following reasons:1) I've put mine through the ringer and it has performed beautifully2) It's very easy to sharpen and the edge lasts3) The head of it is not to big that you can't "palm it" to use as a cutting instrument or even for skinning4) It's light enough to always carry but heavy enough to split and chop5) The fire rod stays in place and is a good size for use

qa_pair.question: Is this axe good for a survival tool or not?
qa_pair.answer: Yes it is

qa_pair.question: Is this axe good for a survival tool or not?
qa_pair.answer: It is awesome. I would have frozen if I had not taken this with me. I cut twenty or so 6" diameter logs with ease to keep my fire going all night.

qa_pair.question: Is this axe good for a survival tool or not?
qa_pair.answer: In my humble opinion, I would say the Schrade SCAXE2L is a fantastic choice for a survival axe. It is very well built with a very comfortable handle, and comes with a fire striker in the handle and sharpening stone. Alas, it can be used as an effective hammer as well.

qa_pair.question: Is this axe good for a survival tool or not?
qa_pair.answer: It is an excellent axe, I just had to run outside and cut something so I wouldn't be just talking. I have not used the firestarter yet. You're gonna have to wait on that review.

qa_pair.question: How  long will  the co2 cartridge  maintain pressure afer it is pierced.

qa_pair.question: How user-friendly is the storage aspect in terms of effort and feasibility? How does one store it against a wall with a tank full of water?
qa_pair.answer: The Oxford WaterRower is extremely easy to store. Because of the way the unit is balanced, you can lift it up with one hand and easily roll it away for storage or just stand it so it takes up less floor space. You can stand it up with a tank full of water because of the way the tank is designed. It is an oval and you do no fill it entirely up (there is a calibrated level mark on the side of the tank). When it stands up, there is never any leakage because the fill port stays above the liquid level. The WaterRower is the best piece of home exercise equipment I have ever used.

Sincerely, Regis in NJ.

qa_pair.question: Hi, How do you adjust the resistance on this rower ?
qa_pair.answer: The tank has graduated marks on a clear label indicating water level.  The higher the water level, the more there is to move, and the greater the effort required to move it--to a point. Beyond this, there is no way to increase "resistance" as you can with some other systems.  But then, if you were rowing a scull the only way to increase resistance is to put more weight in the boat or drag a sea anchor.

rewrite.edit: There are graduated marks on a clear label which tell you the water level on the tank. The higher the water level, the more there is to move and more effort is required.

You adjust the resistance on the rower by changing the water level on the tank.  The higher the water level, the more there is to move and the more energy you will have to exert.

qa_pair.question: Hi, How do you adjust the resistance on this rower ?

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the "flipper" on this knife and a conventional assisted opening knife?
qa_pair.answer: You pull down on the flipper with your index finger and flick your wrist at the same time. The blade will open fully and lock in the blink of an eye.

rewrite.edit: The difference is you pull down on the flipper with your index finger and flick your wrist simultaneously. The blade opens fully and locks instantly.

The difference between this knife and a conventional assisted opening knife is that this knife has a flipper you pull down on while flicking your wrist. The blade opens fully and locked in the blink of an eye.
The blade will open fully and lock in the blink of an eye.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the "flipper" on this knife and a conventional assisted opening knife?
qa_pair.answer: It is alot smoother and easier to use, very comfortable as well. Sorry for such a short answer but its one of those things where only experience can really give you the answer you want.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the "flipper" on this knife and a conventional assisted opening knife?
qa_pair.answer: An assisted opening knife only takes a small amount of manual movement before the spring or cam takes over. A flipper knife like this one is completely manual. If you don't open it forcefully enough, it will fail to deploy and you will have to use the thumb studs to finish opening it. If it feels too tight to open easily, you can loosen the screw holding the blade on or completely disassemble and lube the action and it will smooth everything up.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the "flipper" on this knife and a conventional assisted opening knife?
qa_pair.answer: I don't know precisely how conventional AO knives work, but there is no assist on this knife. If you open it halfway, it won't complete the motion.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the "flipper" on this knife and a conventional assisted opening knife?
qa_pair.answer: 'Assisted opening' means that a spring or other mechanical force will finish the opening of the knife by itself once the blade is open a certain amount. The flipper is just a piece of metal that is part of the blade itself that is a more convenient way to open the knife with one hand. On this knife, you even have to give the blade a 'flick', as force on the flipper is not enough to fully open the knife into the locked position.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the "flipper" on this knife and a conventional assisted opening knife?
qa_pair.answer: To be precise, this knife opens on the power of you actuating the flipper.  There is no internal spring assist with this knife.  I found that my item was a little slow at first on the opening flip action, but quickly has loosened up.  I suppose a little drop of oil would make it quicker.  This is a low- dollar flipper.  The more expensive flippers are like greased lightening out of the box.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the "flipper" on this knife and a conventional assisted opening knife?
qa_pair.answer: As other said it's not an assisted knife. I honestly don't know how Kershaw sells this knife with the flipper being flat and smooth. I love this knife and carry it every day but couldn't stand how smooth it was. I used a dremmel to create a "grip" on the flipper and i'm much happier with it.

qa_pair.question: How does the 14C28N steel compare to rather common steel types: 8cr13, 440c, AUS8, or 154cm? [Rust/ Corrosion, Edge Retension, Ease to Sharpen]?
qa_pair.answer: Very easy to sharpen. Takes a fine edge. VERY sharp. Hold better than most. 154,s30v and Elmax are far superior though. Good for the price compared to the others.

rewrite.edit: These are very easy to sharpen and hold better than most. The 154, S30V and Elmax are superior though.
This knife is very easy to sharpen. It takes a fine edge and is very sharp. The 154, s30v and Elmax are superior knives, however, this knife is a good value for the price.
Very easy to sharpen. Takes a fine edge. VERY sharp. Hold better than most.

qa_pair.question: How does the 14C28N steel compare to rather common steel types: 8cr13, 440c, AUS8, or 154cm? [Rust/ Corrosion, Edge Retension, Ease to Sharpen]?
qa_pair.answer: I like it, I think it holds an edge well and is decently easy to sharpen. Probably better than 8cr13 or 440c in my opinion, not sure about AUS8 I don't have any personal experience with that. Doesn't hold an edge as well as VG-10 but isn't as brittle either (and easier to sharpen).

qa_pair.question: How does the 14C28N steel compare to rather common steel types: 8cr13, 440c, AUS8, or 154cm? [Rust/ Corrosion, Edge Retension, Ease to Sharpen]?
qa_pair.answer: The 14C28N steel holds up extremely well. It will take a shaving edge quite easily but likes a slightly steeper bevel. That being said, the Skyline holds a sharp edge for quite some time with heavy use, better than the AUS8. It WILL get a light brown rust on it if exposed to water and left but nothing that wont come off with a scotch pad. In conclusion, this is a sharp, tough knife with excellent edge retention and a blade that is easy to care for. Highly recommend it for someone who will USE it.

qa_pair.question: Is this a real gun?, or a cool toy?
qa_pair.answer: Well this is a replica Sig Sauer p226 X5. It weighs almost 3 pounds and is made fully of metal including the full size magazine. It can be field stripped just like the actual firearm and requires the regular maintenance such as lubrication for all the metal parts. It shoots .177 cal steel bbs and has a strong blowback feature. When the last round is fired the slide locks back just like an actual pistol. This pistol is the closest u can ever come to purchasing an actual firearm.

qa_pair.question: Is this a real gun?, or a cool toy?
qa_pair.answer:
In the strictest sense, it is a .177 caliber bb gun. Your state and local laws determine if it is a toy or a weapon. I highly recommend you check your state and local laws before purchasing any firearm be it a .177cal or a .50cal. The real issue with this and other models of bb guns that are designed to look and feel like their larger caliber counterparts is that they look and operate just like the real deal, and consequently could be misinterpreted by law enforcement officials resulting in a series of unfortunate events. So, my advice to anyone who asks is simple. Know your state and local laws, and treat every firearm - toy or real, with the respect due a real firearm in order to prevent accidental loss of human life.

qa_pair.question: does this phone require a data plan?
qa_pair.answer: I believe it does, if you choose to have Verizon as your provider, but you might doublecheck with them. You can however, also use with MVNO Page Plus Cellular Service, which is month to month, and choose to not use data once your phone has activated. You must, however be aware that setup and apps can use cellular data and must therefore use Wifi capability for those functions. Also MMS (pic and video texts) require cellular data (will not work with Wifi), and many people's smartphones use MMS automatically instead of SMS (which does not require cellular data) when texting.

The phone does not run on Android, but runs on WebOS. WebOS is an operating system developed by Palm and HP. The phone has a clean USN.

This product comes with the phone, a USB cable, an C?DC USB wall plug, and a battery. It is compatible with a Verizon data plan and Page Plus Cellular. The phone is unlocked. It does not come with a SIM card but you can activate it or exchange it with an older phone. This runs WebOS.  It was an operating system developed by Palm and the HP when they bought Palm. It is a discontinued OS but one that is supported by a lot of WebOS fans and hackers.

qa_pair.answer: First of all, I wouldn't wait until the bag was actually FULL, because that's disgusting.  As for where you can safety discard your bag o' poo, that rather depends on where you are. qa_pair.question: Description says cools 40°F below ambient temp. Will it keep food frozen if the ambient is below 72°F? Have you tried it? Does it have temp control?
qa_pair.answer: It does not have temp control. Also, it seems to depend where you place the food in the cooler and how long you've been running the cooler--the longer you run it, the colder it seems to get nearest the output area.

qa_pair.question: Please confirm this item can be fitted to Glock 35 ?  And rear sight with both windage and elevation adjustment  ?
qa_pair.answer: All dovetails are created pretty much the same so it will fit. However, if you're attempting this on your own keep a dremel with a grinder bit handy. It takes a steady hand to fit it properly. As well, invest in the upper vice with site tool, works better than attempting to use a punch set and wont damage the sight either. It is adjustable with a third screw hole that will lock the sight adjustments. Front blade is higher set than most and may require shaving for fit in some holsters. Hope that helps.

qa_pair.question: since it sounds like the front sight is quite a bit taller, would you still recommend it for ccw with bigger holster or a home defense sight?
qa_pair.answer: You are right about the front sight being larger, so if you plan to holster it, you will need a larger holster.  The thing that sets this sight apart is that it is adjustable.  For many shooters, that's critical because they consistently pull the pistol to the right or left when they pull the trigger.  It is a great sight for home defense.

qa_pair.question: since it sounds like the front sight is quite a bit taller, would you still recommend it for ccw with bigger holster or a home defense sight?
qa_pair.answer: NO! For your specified requirements I would get the Meprolight non-adjustable Tru-dot Night Sights or Tru-Glo TFO Tritium night sights for your Glock. The replacement screw for the taller and more likely to snag front sight makes it vulnerable to breaking off.

qa_pair.question: since it sounds like the front sight is quite a bit taller, would you still recommend it for ccw with bigger holster or a home defense sight?
qa_pair.answer: David, yes as the front sights of the original glock sights are to short and cause the pistols to shoot high, a common problem. You're only talking about a 16th of an inch taller, and the rear sights are adjustable to boot. I've been in law enforcement for 35 years, and believe me, by up grading to these sights, you  greatly improve the  glock. Finding a holster will not be a problem.

qa_pair.question: What is the weapon retention feature? (strap or push button)
qa_pair.answer: There is no manual retention feature. It essentially snaps into place and is held there by an enlarged piece of material at the trigger guard. You have to give it a jerk to come out.

rewrite.edit: There isn't a manual retention feature. The weapon basically snaps into place and is held by an enlarged piece of material at the trigger guard.

qa_pair.question: What is the weapon retention feature? (strap or push button)
qa_pair.answer: Neither.  The firearm clips snug in the molded portion and can only be drawn by a directly vertical pull.  There is a screw adjustment on the side to manage the tension of the holster grip on the weapon.  It takes some tweaking to get the holster grip and angle of draw down so you can do it smoothly.  It's quite comfortable to use.

qa_pair.question: What is the weapon retention feature? (strap or push button)
qa_pair.answer: Neither.....the retention feature is a "squeeze" function on the front, inner portion of the trigger guard. Simple friction holds the gun in the holster. It is adjustable.

qa_pair.question: What is the weapon retention feature? (strap or push button)
qa_pair.answer: Self locking and it's great.  You can run, tumble, etc and it won't come out.  You actually have to give your weapon a quick snap to release it from the holster.  I never had one that was more comfortable.

qa_pair.question: how well does the blade sharpen and how long does it stay sharp under use ??
qa_pair.answer: It actually sharpens very well, and quickly! 8Cr13MoV is a high-grade stainless steel that is slightly softer than, say, AUS-8 (itss most comparative steel, some say). With a good diamond sharpener, I've found that the blade sharpens fast, and stays sharp under normal/moderately extreme use, from breaking down cardboard boxes to carving sandstone (though highly possible, the latter use is not a good use for any knife). Try the Smith's PocketPal sharpener or one of Kershaw's sharpeners. Hope that helps!

qa_pair.question: how well does the blade sharpen and how long does it stay sharp under use ??

qa_pair.question: how well does the blade sharpen and how long does it stay sharp under use ??
qa_pair.answer: Sharpenes easily and quickly stays sharp fairly long time considering the price it is a little hard to sharpen the tanto edge at the end. For the price I paid it is well worth it. If you want awesome sharpness get so etching with D2 steel that stuff is amazing

qa_pair.question: how well does the blade sharpen and how long does it stay sharp under use ??
qa_pair.answer: I've had it for a month today, the 11th. It came to me out of the box, Sharp as a razor. It is used daily for random little things. As of today it is still sharp enough to take the hair off my arm. I am not too sure as to how well it Sharpens, but it stays pretty sharp for a long time. If you want a knife that wont cost you a fortune, then go with this one. You will not be let down by it.

qa_pair.question: how well does the blade sharpen and how long does it stay sharp under use ??
qa_pair.answer: I carry mine every day, but probably only use it a few times a week. Under those conditions, I'd say it holds its edge extremely well. I've sharpened mine 3 times in 2 years. The first 2 times with an inexpensive pocket sharpener that worked surprisingly well. The 3rd and last time I sharpened it with an oilstone that gave it a razor sharp edge. I *love* this knife.

qa_pair.question: How do you close the knife?
qa_pair.answer: It's simple enough. When the knife opens a piece of metal in the handle slides into place and locks the blade open. Look at the groove carved out for your thumb and you will see it.

qa_pair.question: Does this book have load data for 300 AAC Blackout?
qa_pair.answer: Mark, It does have load data, but they are light on the powder loads, I hand reloaded for my AAC upper with these loads it was short stroking, I switched to the specific load listed by AAC in the upper manual and have no issues, but for my 45ACP and 5.56 loads this book was pretty spot on. hope that helps.

qa_pair.question: Does this book have load data for 300 AAC Blackout?

qa_pair.question: Does this book have load data for 300 AAC Blackout?
qa_pair.answer: Dear Mark ,   The 9th Hornady has 7 pages of loads of the 300 AAC , starting with 110 gr projectiles , through 125-130 gr , 150-155 gr , 165-168gr , 178-180gr , 190 gr , 195 gr , 208 gr till 225gr .The velocity range is 2400 fps for the lightest projectile to 1400 fps for the heaviest of the 308 calibre Hornadys .RegardsPaul.

qa_pair.question: Does this book have load data for 300 AAC Blackout?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, it does. Page 380 of Hornady's Edition 9 gives reloading data on the 300 Whisper/AAC Blackout round. It also gives the differences of the Whisper and AAC cartridges. If you are thinking about buying Edition 9, I don't believe you will be disappointed in the info throughout the manual. I bought my edition 9 for the .223 and 5.56 info.

qa_pair.question: i put this out yesterday and filled it and it wont turn on? it was 38 degrees is that to cold?
qa_pair.answer: You should be able to test the feeder's operation. "TEST FEEDER: PRESS AND HOLD the SET button while the RUN-TIME SECONDS are displayed. Release the button and getaway from the feeder when the message "TESTING GET AWAY" appears on the display. Cold weather can affect your battery. I use a rechargeable battery and solar recharger. I have not experienced any problems. Try the testing procedures first to verify that the mechanism is working. If not, contact Moultrie.

qa_pair.question: Are they throw always after one use?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, they are single use items.I use these when playing golf on cold mornings. I open one ~1 hr before playing and discard them when finished playing; therefore I get ~5-6 hrs. use out of each one. They are still warm/hot when I dispose of them. I live in Arizona where I only need them on cold mornings. I'm not sure how long they would last if I was doing outdoor activities all day in a cold climate.I used to but these at a golf store that charge ~$2 per 2 pack so buying in bulk is a good savings!

qa_pair.question: Are they throw always after one use?
qa_pair.answer: Once the airtight packaging is opened the handwarmers start a reaction with oxygen in the air and the handwarmer ingredients, that creates heat, and lasts about 10 hours. After this time the reaction stops and can not be recharged. If oxygen is cut off, such as putting them into a ziplock bag, the reaction stops and they cool. Exposed to air again they resume generating heat, but never beyond a total of 10 hours they would have lasted if they were used continuously.

qa_pair.question: Are they throw always after one use?

qa_pair.question: Which is the difference between the Tanto Pt. Half Serr. and the Tanto Pt. Plain?
qa_pair.answer: The tanto half serration knife has serrations at,the begging of.the.blade.to aid in cutting things like thick rope and small sapplings and things where a sawing method would be easier than using the actual blade i like the serrations better than the plane.blade.it makes It a more versitaile tool

qa_pair.question: Which is the difference between the Tanto Pt. Half Serr. and the Tanto Pt. Plain?
qa_pair.answer: the differences is the half serrated will tear and cut through rope or things your trying to open and the plain will just be a plain blade with a tanto point in my personal opinion i prefer the half serrated edge because it makes cutting easier but you will need a diamond rod to sharpen the serrations

qa_pair.question: Which is the difference between the Tanto Pt. Half Serr. and the Tanto Pt. Plain?

A. S. T. FOLDING POCKET KNIVES........GERBER TACTICAL TANTO........REALLY GOOD QUALITY FOLDING POCKET KNIVES.....

qa_pair.question: what does it use as fuel
qa_pair.answer: Muscle power, it is a break action air rifle, you cock it (load the air chamber) by pulling the barrel down and back towards the trigger. The rifle comes with directions on how to do it properly. Once it is fully cocked you place a pellet in the breech and close the barrel, you are then "cocked and loaded" ready to fire.

The break action of air rifle cocked you place a pellet in the breech and close the barrel in the fuel used.

qa_pair.question: what does it use as fuel
qa_pair.answer:
It doesn't use fuel...it is called a "break away" barrel. You pull the barrel down to cock it using it's internal spring, and return the barrel to the original position to fire it....the rifle is VERY powerful, and extremely accurate when you use the manual rear sight and the fiber optic front sight...I took the scope off, because I have a Gamo .177 w/ a scope...and sometimes you just don't want a scope for certain targets. It is now my rifle of choice, and I never even use the Gamo anymore. Word of information...to cock it, you must rap the front of the barrel on top....that breaks it away slightly, and then you can pull all the way down to complete cocking it...wasn't aware of the procedure at first, but it's no big deal. Great rifle!...I'd buy another one if this one is lost. Buy the Crossman hollow point pellets...they're cheap, and superb....BTW...I sold the scope on Ebay for about $18

qa_pair.question: what does it use as fuel

qa_pair.question: what does it use as fuel
qa_pair.answer: It's a break-barrel type "spring air" type gun. The barrel is attached to the guy by way of a sturdy hinge, and when you pivot the barrel downward, it compresses a spring inside the body of the gun. When the gun is fired, the spring pushes a piston forward, compressing air and forcing it into the barrel behind the pellet.

qa_pair.question: What fabric is the bag?
qa_pair.answer: Is a light canvas material, it does notExpand, so if you tide the tent with at Least 3 bungee cords it makes it easierTo get the tent in the bag. Happy camping :)

rewrite.edit: This is a light canvas material that doesn't expand. You need at least 3 bungee cords to tide the tent.

qa_pair.question: What fabric is the bag?
qa_pair.answer: I am pretty sure it is similar if not the same as the tent. There is also a white strip on the bottom of the bag, that when you pull it off, expands the bag so that the tent fits after you use it. Pretty cool feature, as I can never fit the tent into the bag without a ton of bungee cords, now I just use two or three to hold it together.

qa_pair.question: What fabric is the bag?
qa_pair.answer: Bag is a cheap nylon, pretty thin. But it works fine and the bottom seam can be expanded after unpacking for the first time. If going from the campsite to the back of the car it will hold up fine.

qa_pair.question: Is it suitable for the summer heat?
qa_pair.answer: without the fly it would be as warm or cool as any other tent.  the zippered windows and doors all have zip down "walls" to reveal the screens to let air in/through the tent.

rewrite.edit: Without the fly this would be as warm or cool as any other tent. The zippered windows and doors all have zip down walls.
This product could potentially be hot in the summer, but the windows may allow enough air to come in that it would be bearable.
The tent will perform as well as other tents when using it without the fly.

qa_pair.question: Is it suitable for the summer heat?
qa_pair.answer: Yes. One of my favorite things about the tent are it's large windows on all four side that allows for excellent ventilation.

qa_pair.question: Is it suitable for the summer heat?
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely!  Very large windows on all four sides, makes for great ventilation.  Just like any tent if it's closed up they tend to get a little toasty inside. You can adjust the amount the window is open by using the zippered flaps.  I fold the flaps in and use chip clips to keep them in place. Great tents!

summary: This product does come with a bag of metal spikes to stake it into the ground and the floor is made of a plastic tarp. This tent has 4 screened windows and if they are closed, it should protect against dusty environment If the windows are open, it probably will not but it could allow enough air in the summer that the heat would be bearable. This tent can be set up inside if the area is bigger than the dimensions of the tent itself. This product is only rain proof if the rain top is attached and the bag for this tent is made of a light canvas material.

qa_pair.question: Does this Rod have good tip action; or is the tip very stiff?

qa_pair.question: Does this Rod have good tip action; or is the tip very stiff?
qa_pair.answer: I thought the tip action was good. it was not flimsy that would cause line wraps and the bend was pretty uniform. A lot more flex than their next size up. qa_pair.question: Do you think this would support a twin-size mattress for occasional use as an extra bed?
qa_pair.answer: while the cot supports adult weight (and is quite comfortable as is) I think a twin mattress would be a clumsy fit and too heavy.  Camp cots are low to the ground and not very wide. qa_pair.question: How to fold the cart?
qa_pair.answer: First you press the button on the bottom at the top of the wheel shaft, that will fold the front tire under the main bar. Then you up the latch up just about the top loop,and that will fold down the handle and the back wheels will fold in toward the main bar or shaft.

rewrite.edit: You need to press the bottom at the top of the wheel shaft. Then just fold the latch up and the rest will follow.

To fold this cart, press the button at the top of the wheel shaft at the bottom to fold the front tire under the main bar. Then move the latch up to the top loop, which will fold the handle down and back wheels toward the shaft.

qa_pair.question: How to fold the cart?
qa_pair.answer: At a point about where those metal rods intersect with the handle shaft, there is a piece that slides UP. This piece may have a lock mechanism. Once this is slid up, the cart will fold. Be sure to unlock and fold the single front wheel back first! I hope this helps.

summary: To fold this cart, press the button at the top of the wheel shaft at the bottom to fold the front tire under the main bar. Then move the latch up to the top loop, which will fold the handle down and back wheels toward the shaft. The umbrella holder on this cart can be removed and re-attached easily. This cart can hold a stand bag. The straps are elastic and can stretch. To collapse this bag, find the red gadget in the middle that connects the bottom with the top. Pull it up and toward yourself. That will make the cart fold. To open it, pull it toward yourself again. This cart is easier to push up to a 20% grade than to pull it. The spacing for this cart is for normal-sized bags and wouldn't likely fit a junior golf bag. To fit in this cart, a bag needs to be at least 32.5 inches tall. This cart is not electric, so it doesn't have a battery. However, it is a very good cart for the price.

qa_pair.question: Could you use this without the mattress and just put your sleeping bags on it?
qa_pair.answer: Yes you can use this as cot without the mattress, although the zippered mattress sheet is permanently attached to the cot fabric. Simply remove the air mattress. It is in fact equivalent to two 30" width cots adding up to 60" fabric with both cots sharing a frame rail down the center however so the downside is that you'll be unable sleep centrally on the cot.  Without the air mattress, either one side or both sides of the cot can be used, just not down the middle.

qa_pair.question: Could you use this without the mattress and just put your sleeping bags on it?

qa_pair.question: Do the pads of this seat actually move as you pedal, or are they ridged?
qa_pair.answer: They actually move as you pedal. Each moves independently, so as one leg extends to push the pedal down, the pad on that side will pivot down slightly. At the same time, the opposite pad will pivot up slightly as your opposite knee bends on the upstroke.

rewrite.edit: The pads of the seat move as you pedal. Each pad moves independently. When you extend one leg to push the pedal down the pad on that slide pivots down and the other pad pivots up.

qa_pair.question: does it have a chiseled edge or convex
qa_pair.answer: As Thomas said, technically this is a modified saber (scandi) grind. Even though Ontario's site lists this as a flat grind, which it is not. A flat grind has a bevel that immediately starts at the spine and ends at the edge. A saber grind maintains the same blade thickness for approximately 1/2 - 1/3 the width of the blade before the bevel begins.

qa_pair.question: what is the eye slit thingy for? sorry if that sounds like a dumb question
qa_pair.answer: It's used for sighting the course you intend to follow. As you turn the compass to the magnetic direction you want to go the sight wire shows you where that direction is in the distance or on the horizon. It gives you a more precise reading to follow.

rewrite.edit: This item is used for sighting a path by turning the product in the magnetic direction to follow. The sight's intention is to provide more accurate reading of where to follow.
That direction is in the distance or on the horizon. It gives you a more precise reading to follow.
This is used for sighting the course you intend to follow. As turn the compass to the magnetic direction to go the sight wire shows you where that direction.

qa_pair.question: what is the eye slit thingy for? sorry if that sounds like a dumb question
qa_pair.answer: It acts like a gunsight and focuser.  If you look through the slit, you can see both the wire and the distant object, so you can center the distant object on the wire.  The wire is in line with the center black line of the bezel.  Many persons may not see the wire and the distant object simultaneously because the wire is only inches from your eye, its very close.   The slit also then works then like a pinhole eyeglass or Inuit snow goggle allowing the user to focus easier and see the wire too.

qa_pair.question: what is the eye slit thingy for? sorry if that sounds like a dumb question
qa_pair.answer: That is for shooting a sight line ,say to a pole about 600 feet away or a tree,then continuing. The lens is for Reading the numbers on the compass face,then shoot a bearing where you want to go

qa_pair.question: what is the eye slit thingy for? sorry if that sounds like a dumb question
qa_pair.answer: When you shoot an azimuth, you will line up that U-shaped notch on top of the lens with the base of the sighting wire and look through the lens to read the number off your dial.  If you're trying to walk a straight line on a specific bearing (e.g., 325 degrees or N 35° W), you can find a landmark right on the wire and walk towards it.  If you want to know the azimuth to a given landmark (or two landmarks, to triangulate your position), it's as easy as pointing your compass at it.

qa_pair.question: what is the eye slit thingy for? sorry if that sounds like a dumb question
qa_pair.answer: No I asked also. With a compass, you look through the eyepiece and and fix the compass wheel point to line up with a landmark you want to get to. You then have the direction, north, south, etc to follow the compass line on.

qa_pair.question: Can anyone please explain what "balanced for the Northern Hemispere" means? Guessing it it something to do with Magnetic North vs. Geographic North...
qa_pair.answer: Timothy,The Earth's magnetic poles are located above the surface of the Earth. When a compass is in the Northern Hemisphere, the magnetic pole is above the compass and pulls up on the North end of the needle. In the Southern Hemisphere the same is true for the South end of the needle. The compass is balanced by adding weight to the North end of the needle for compasses used in the Northern Hemisphere and weight to the South end of the needle for compasses used in the Southern Hemisphere.

rewrite.edit: This product is manufactured for use in the northern hemisphere, meaning it contains a magnetic balance that pulls northward. In contrast, a similar item for use in the southern hemisphere would use a needle that is magnetically configured to pull southward.
The compass is balanced by adding weight to the North end of the needle for compasses used in the Northern Hemisphere .Northern Hemispere" means

qa_pair.question: Can anyone please explain what "balanced for the Northern Hemispere" means? Guessing it it something to do with Magnetic North vs. Geographic North...
qa_pair.answer:
Timothy,  The effect the earth has on the needle of  a compass is different in the northern hemisphere than in the southern hemisphere.  Compasses built for the northern part of the earth, above the equator have the needle "balanced" so that it is level when the compass is level.  If you buy a compass built by a company located  in the southern hemisphere the south end of the needle will probably float hi as compared to the north end.  Cammenga manufactures here in the USA so their compass card  is balanced for our local.  This military marching compass is really so  easy to use.  The body of  the compass has a nice straight edge along one side making it very useful when you want to align a map to any one of its three coordinates.  The military has used this compass for many years and it is a proven performer.  Note, if you want lots of features such as inclination, mirror imaging with see through hole, adjustable declination,  etc. there are lots of  much more complicated compasses available.All compasses point to the same place, magnetic north, no matter who made the compass.  However, the earth rotates on an axis running through the North Pole to the South Pole.  This axis is not magnetic, it is geographic and called "true north."  Magnetic north is off to one  side of the axis, though this is a somewhat simple explanation.  If any compass points other than magnetic north then it has been adjusted for declination, the difference between true north and magnetic.  Declination varies depending on your location on the earth's  surface.

qa_pair.question: Is this compass liquid filled?
qa_pair.answer: No it is NOT liquid filled.  The dial balances on a pivot point, and when the case is closed, the dial is locked into place to help prevent damage.

qa_pair.question: Is this compass liquid filled?
qa_pair.answer: No, this is a "magnetic induction" compass. It is dampened magnetically and sits in a sealed, non-liquid-filled chamber. The military does this so that the compass will continue to function normally in the event the glass is broken. This is not a cheap undampened compass, but in fact a more expensive inductive dampened compass.

qa_pair.question: does this compass have declination adjustment?
qa_pair.answer: No.  One must account for declination mathematically when using an Army issue compass; declination is indicated on MGRS maps and should be calculated in after reading.

summary: This product is a 27 Clam Shell compass used for sighting the course you intend to follow. The Earth's magnetic poles are located above the surface of the Earth. When a compass is in the Northern Hemisphere, the magnetic pole is above the compass and pulls up on the North end of the needle. In the Southern Hemisphere the same is true for the South end of the needle. The compass is balanced by adding weight to the North end of the needle for compasses used in the Northern Hemisphere. The sight wire shows you what direction you are going using the magnetic poles as a guide. The compass has a jeweled dial which is faster and more accurate than a liquid dial. The compass mirror has a diameter of 5 cm. The length of the compass is 12.5 cm  when open and 7.5 cm when closed. The width of the compass is 5.6 cm. The product weighs 145 grams including the strap.  Declination is indicated on MGRS maps. Instructions are included.

qa_pair.question: Is this a range finder? Thank you!
qa_pair.answer: Not really.  It is a great pocket size spotting scope.  You can use the optics to make a good guess on range of something but no range finding electronics.  Hope this helps.

qa_pair.question: Is this a range finder? Thank you!
qa_pair.answer: This has range finding capabilities using the MIL scale reticle.  It is NOT a laser range finder, but if you are willing to do a bit of math and practice, it works well.  Benefit is that it does not require batteries.  An accessory that helps with using MIL scale ranging is the Mil dot master.

qa_pair.question: Is this a range finder? Thank you!
qa_pair.answer: Yes. It is a range finder. Range is defined by MIL scale reticle and small human figures for approximate calculations, no lasers inside (it would raise price up to 400$)

qa_pair.question: Is this a range finder? Thank you!
qa_pair.answer: the monocular has a military spec. reticle range-finder ---  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reticle ... if you know the approx size of the object you're looking at, you can calculate the range.  There is also a handy silhouette range finder for a torso-sized object at 300m, 400m, 500m & 600m.

qa_pair.question: At 100 yards, is there real clarity of the object?
qa_pair.answer: The glass is phenomenal.  At 100 yards, you will not be able to identify .223 holes in paper, but maybe .308 holes in a color-change splatter target.  For ranging a small to medium sized animal (jack rabbit through deer) this works absolutely perfect.

qa_pair.question: At 100 yards, is there real clarity of the object?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, the image is sharp and clear on a considerably bigger distance. But I doubt that you can use reading tables or use it for target shooting in order to spot holes left from gun shots. It is a job for x20-80 scopes.

qa_pair.question: At 100 yards, is there real clarity of the object?
qa_pair.answer: The glass is crystal clear and it works well for what it is designed for which is using the reticle to measure objects for range estimation. The image is very sharp, has no color aberrations, and the view is clear from edge to edge, not just in the middle like some monoculars. I personally love the reticle and the fact that this has a separate adjustment to focus the reticle. I wish I had one of these back when I was in Armor in the army. The view is much clearer than the high dollar binoculars we had back then.

qa_pair.question: At 100 yards, is there real clarity of the object?
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely. The optics is superb, its razor sharp and no chromatic abberation is visible. But keep in mind, it's a 8x power scope, so the angular resolution is of a 8x power scope too. You will can identify any bird with it, but no insects ;)

qa_pair.question: At 100 yards, is there real clarity of the object?

qa_pair.question: how do i know if this is real bench made??
qa_pair.answer: It's being sold by a marketplace dealer, but the stock is being stored and shipped by Amazon. I've bought plenty of high-end knives through Amazon, and never had a problem. The specs are all correct, the model numbers are right, and the price is about where you'd expect; I purchased mine through Amazon.ca, but I'd have no concerns about buying it here. In the slight chance there is a problem, you can always send it back for a full refund.

qa_pair.question: how do i know if this is real bench made??

qa_pair.question: Is this mount high enough to prevent front sight of the MP 15 sport from being an obstruction?
qa_pair.answer: If your scope has a power above about 2.5x, the focus of the scope is beyond the front sight, so the front sight is invisible.  My M4 has a front sight and I use a 3-9x and do not see the front sight at all.

qa_pair.question: Is this mount high enough to prevent front sight of the MP 15 sport from being an obstruction?
qa_pair.answer: No, the front site will stick up into your field of view. That being said, it depends on the power of your scope as to whether or not you will notice it. I use this mount with a Nikon P-223 3-9x and I only notice a glare my front site on the lowest zoom and when in direct sunlight. At 100 yards, I can still keep 30 rounds within a four inch radius. I have heard that you can swap out the front sight for a gas block, but I haven't tried it yet.

summary: The NIKON 1in M-223 Scope Mount’s distance from outside is 4-1/2" and 3-3/16" from the inside. The mount's height from the rail top to the scope tube bottom is about 23mm. The mount is high enough to prohibit front sight obstruction. The M-223 Mount version lacks MOA built-in, but the M-223 XR Mount contains 20 MOA built-in for a long shooting range. The front site post is invisible when looking through the scope. The products work effectively with restaff but are costly. The scope is the best alternative because it is cheap, well made, and easy to dial.The mount works on Nikon scope, even when the action turret is on as long as one has a military-style rail on the weapon. The m-223 is unable to co-witness magnified optics. For iron backup sights, consider either a quick release scope or red dot mount.

summary: This item comes as pictured. The four tubes all together hold about eighty-eight brasses and can also be used by sliding bullets into position. On the pistol caliber, the dies are carbide and do not lube. The seating die will crimp the brass depending on how high or low you have it set. You can change out the dies to load different calibers, and if you change the die, you can reload 30-06 with this press. This product comes with a .40 die which is the same as 10mm. If it is a large pistol primer, this is not a setup for 10mm. It has a small pistol primer set up for .40. You will need to purchase the die set for the .223 Remington along with a shell plate that holds the brass.

I would suggest you go to web site ,shootandreload.com, and read what the gentleman writes about the lee loadmaster.I have been reloading for more than 50 years and agree with his opinion about lee products. qa_pair.question: Is this A complete .223/5.56 kit ? Besides powder, brass, primers, lead , tumbler, measuring tool 4 brass, what more is there 2 buy? im new 2 reloadin
qa_pair.answer: Buy a reamer to clean out the primer pocet. Also a reamer that works on the case opening. A trimmer for case lengths. If you do not have a carbide die you will need case lube. qa_pair.question: Is this A complete .223/5.56 kit ? Besides powder, brass, primers, lead , tumbler, measuring tool 4 brass, what more is there 2 buy? im new 2 reloadin
qa_pair.answer:
No, you need quite a bit more than just this. For effective priming, you need a sizing decapping die in station 2 (removing the decapping pin). You will also need calipers, scale, trimmer, case prep tool/system, ultra-sonic cleaner (optional rather than using a tumbler), tools for modifying the press if you do not have them (file, sandpaper, wrenches, screwdrivers, graphite powder etc), case lube ((and a lube pad optionally) although it does come with a small amount of lube).This one you may already have but a VERY sturdy bench/table. I would also really recommend a book to get the exact size, COL, powder amount etc that you need to get in the end result, in addition to the useful knowledge you will get.

qa_pair.question: how does this book differ from lymans 49th edition reloading manual?
qa_pair.answer: It differs in the fact that it deals exclusively with cast bullets. It contains a great deal of info concerning the casting of your own bullets. Alloys, technique, safety, the whole gamut. Finally, lots of loading data. This loading data uses not only their profiles but also some of their competitors'. It is truly a complete source of cast bullet data. Nothing else comes near.

qa_pair.question: how does this book differ from lymans 49th edition reloading manual?
qa_pair.answer: This manual is devoted to casting bullets and cast bullet loads. It has load data for a lot of very old (obsolete) cartridges. It has load data for bullets from molds other than Lyman, such as Lee, NEI and Hornady. It contains a lot of metalurgy information that's really above what I do with cast bullets. I just cast bullets from whatever I have and drop them into water. Some work extremely well and some are less stellar. It's now my go to book for casting problems and cast load data.

qa_pair.question: how does this book differ from lymans 49th edition reloading manual?
qa_pair.answer: As the title states, this manual is solely concerned with information regarding the practice of bullet casting and load data for same. It contains no load data for bullets of any other type of construction other than hard cast lead.

qa_pair.question: Hows the trigger using pellets with this gun? Thanks!
qa_pair.answer: Hi Jackson, the trigger is typical of any CO2 pistol in this range where you have to pull through from the start. The trigger also rotates the magazine and therefore have a little bit of resistance. It is however a fairly smooth continuous pull that is fairly predictable and allow for good grouping.

qa_pair.question: every time i shoot this ppq pistol i smell the CO2 is that normal???

If you have a cleaning rod and pad attachment that will work with the .17 cal. barrel, I would try cleaning it with a dry pad to remove any excess oils.

summary: This product is air gun non blowback pistol. The trigger is typical of any CO2 pistol in this range where you have to pull through from the start. The trigger also rotates the magazine and therefore have a little bit of resistance. This product is used just to target practice and loads .177 pellets or 4.5 mm steel bb's in their respective 8 shot cylinder magazines. Laser to the gun is universal while the rail mount and flashlight are a bit too large. This product is made with polymer upper and lower with metal parts inside and the CO2 is odorless. This means you may want to change a different cartridge source as the gas may be contaminated.

summary: This tent has two doors located inside the 90 degree angle. The tent requires at least two people to set up.  Looking at the tent as an L, it has a door on the vertical portion and another on the horizontal portion. The tent has a large footprint but most campsites will accommodate it. The size allows entry space for shoes and coats which cuts down on clutter in the main room. The dimensions of the small room within the tent could are about the size of a queen size air mattress. There is a yellow air condition vent which located at the bottom of the tent. It also includes a non flat rain cover to keep it dry that fits to the top of the tent. Note that the tent lacks a plug hookup or e-port.

qa_pair.answer: The coating is typically applied electrostatically and is then cured under heat to allow it to flow and form a "skin". The powder may be a thermoplastic or a thermoset polymer. qa_pair.question: How does this compare with simple push-ups, pull-ups and crunches? Anybody evaluate this vs exercises that use body-weight only?
qa_pair.answer: This incorporates your entire core using your body weight as well.  It's better than those separate exercises because it causes your abdominal muscles to work synergistically (together) rather than one muscle group at a time.

qa_pair.question: How does this compare with simple push-ups, pull-ups and crunches? Anybody evaluate this vs exercises that use body-weight only?
qa_pair.answer: It's not an alternative to push-ups and pull-ups so you still need to do them. However, crunches don't even come close to what the Ab Carver Pro can do for your abs and your core.

qa_pair.question: How does this compare with simple push-ups, pull-ups and crunches? Anybody evaluate this vs exercises that use body-weight only?
qa_pair.answer: i think using this relatively low priced tool in addition to crunches and pushups/pull-ups, you will achieve the best defined abdominal area ever. Thats my two-cents worth!

qa_pair.question: How does this compare with simple push-ups, pull-ups and crunches? Anybody evaluate this vs exercises that use body-weight only?
qa_pair.answer: This is the more efficient of all things mentioned. June hasn't used it yet due to a previous injury, but I am her husband and I have neverbefore used such a simple thing with so much results in such a short time. My only advice is don't overreach when first starting.

qa_pair.question: How does this compare with simple push-ups, pull-ups and crunches? Anybody evaluate this vs exercises that use body-weight only?
qa_pair.answer: The basic principles are the same. The possibility of injury with the Carver greater because the wrist is not stable and hernia from over extension is always possible.

qa_pair.question: How does this compare with simple push-ups, pull-ups and crunches? Anybody evaluate this vs exercises that use body-weight only?
qa_pair.answer: As far as ab exercises, the regular ab roller wheels are said to be the best tool to use for total core development. This particular roller will also give yu that overall development, but will lessen your core muscle reaction when you return from being extended, due to the built in coil assist. This, all rollers, also assist in arm development. Overall, the roller are better than crunches. I use the regular roller and this one. Push-ups and pull-ups are for chest, arm, core, and back development that could work along side the roller for total development. I hope this helps.

qa_pair.question: How does this compare with simple push-ups, pull-ups and crunches? Anybody evaluate this vs exercises that use body-weight only?
qa_pair.answer: I would say it does not really compare to pull-ups or push-ups. You can incorporate more arm usage if you are very fit and able to reach more as you roll forward. I think it is more effective than traditional crunches, especially for the obliques and lower abdominal muscles. It is somewhat similar to planks, an exercise in which you use your body weight.

qa_pair.question: Is the spring assist adjustable?
qa_pair.answer: Actually, yes it is. Before you use it, roll it forward further then you would if you were doing a rep. The further you roll it, the more the spring recoils and that will give you more return assistance.

qa_pair.question: Is the spring assist adjustable?
qa_pair.answer: There is no mechanism to adjust the spring, but start with it closer to your knees and it will increase the spring tension. If you need/want more tension on the spring start with it on either side and from farther behind your knees.

qa_pair.question: does this set the arm with the pedal or is it just a release
qa_pair.answer: The pedal "cocks", or at least loads the spring when you step down on it, then a chain with a spring in it fires the device.  There is no stopping point where it is cocked and awaiting a pull, step  or other method of release. You manually set the "trigger" lever when you cock the device, then as you step down on the pedal, you're pushing against the spring.  As you move your foot farther down, it trips the cocking lever and lets the clay fly.

rewrite.edit: The device's spring is loaded when the pedal is stepped on, and as further pressure is applied, it will release and launch the target into the air.

You use this product by cocking the pedal which will load the spring when you will step down on it.  There is no stopping point where it is cocked and awaiting a pull, step or other method of release. You manually set the "trigger" lever when you cock the device, then as you step down on the pedal, you're pushing against the spring.

qa_pair.question: Any one tried keeping meat in it overnight?
qa_pair.answer: Yes.  If it is plugged in, it is a cool as a fridge.  If unplugged overnight, have ice packs in the cooler and a blanket on top of the lid for insulation and your food will stay cold and fresh for the next day.  If concerned, put a thermometer in it.

qa_pair.question: Some cars have power flowing to the cigarette lighter even when not running. How fast will it run out the battery?
qa_pair.answer: A typical 100 Ah battery would last up to 20 hours if the cooler draws its maximum 5.0 amps.  Battery temperature in cold weather can affect this by shortening that to some extent.

rewrite.edit: A 100 Ah battery will last up to 20 hours if the cooler draws the maximum 5.0 amps. Battery temperature in cold weather can shorter the lifespan.
cars have power flowing to the cigarette lighter 100 Ah battery would last up to 20 hours if the cooler draws its maximum 5.0 amps.

qa_pair.question: Some cars have power flowing to the cigarette lighter even when not running. How fast will it run out the battery?
qa_pair.answer: It would depend on the condition of the battery. I'm guessing that if the battery is in good condition, with a full charge, it would take a couple days to discharge. I wouldnt take a chance for more than a few hours if I needed that battery. I bought the AC/DC adapter and just run an extension cord to the cooler so as not to drain the vehicle battery (if available). That little fan in the cooler doesn't draw much but it could run your battery down, just like a radio or parking lights left on.

qa_pair.question: Some cars have power flowing to the cigarette lighter even when not running. How fast will it run out the battery?
qa_pair.answer: Mine ran down batteries (4) in my semi when I left it plugged in for 8 hrs. by mistake.

summary: This product does not have a compressor, it is a thermoelectric cooler hose that needs to be plugged into the car or using an inside outlet, as this product has an AC adaptor.  Most cars have power flowing to the cigarette lighter. A one hundred Ah battery will last up to 20 hours if the cooler draws its maximum of 5.0 amps. Watts is 5 amps at 12 volts, so using the standard formula P=EI, wattage is 60. The P65 model has a heat function that is similar to the P27, you simply have to flip over the connector to heat.Meat is kept as cool as it would if it were in a standard refrigerator. If unplugged overnight, it is recommended that you have ice packs in the cooler and a blanket on top of the lid for insulation, and your food will stay cold and fresh for the next day.

summary: This is a set for the 45 Long Colt and the Lee dies are compatible with RCBS and Hornady presses. The loading die set fits the the bullet mold includes a Lee lube and sizer kit. The grey title description refers to carbide as opposed to silver.

qa_pair.question: Is this a better choice for deadlifts vs straight bar?
qa_pair.answer: It will definitely be easier on the lower back, but from articles I've read and researched, it will not involve the hamstrings to as high of a degree.  You could add other exercises to keep the hamstrings exercised thoroughly.  Google "straight bar vs hex bar benefits" and you will find a slew of information.

qa_pair.question: Is this a better choice for deadlifts vs straight bar?
qa_pair.answer: I'd have to give a qualified "yes".  I used my Shrug bar to rehab after a convention deadlift injury late last year.  Because the bar moves through your body's center, there's far less change of injury.  If you are training for competition/powerlifting/crossfit meet, however, you'll still want to train conventional deadlift.  For most of the athletes I coach, who are not competitive lifters, however, I am comfortable recommending the shrug bar as a suitable replacement for conventional deadlifts.  Hope that helps!Clintwww.BarbellsandBourbon.com

qa_pair.question: Is this a better choice for deadlifts vs straight bar?

qa_pair.question: What are benefits of Aimpoint T1 over PRO Patrol Rifle?
qa_pair.answer: Size, weight and ruggedness. One of if not the best red dots on the market. If your rifle is going to see hard use you want a T1.

rewrite.edit: The benefits are the size, weight and ruggedness of the Aimpoint T1. It's one of the best red dots on the market.

qa_pair.question: What are benefits of Aimpoint T1 over PRO Patrol Rifle?
qa_pair.answer: The T1 is much smaller and lighter.   PRO adds significant weight to the rifle, although not as much as a COMP sight.

qa_pair.question: What are benefits of Aimpoint T1 over PRO Patrol Rifle?
qa_pair.answer: The big selling point is size. But it also has about double the battery life and NVG compatible. If those things are not important then go with the PRO. I have both and they are both bomb proof optics.

qa_pair.question: With the aluminum pommel do you feel that you can hammer with this knife, or is it more of a collector's item. Expensive to put in a case.
qa_pair.answer: An average hammer is cheap while a high quality knife is expensive.  Any tool can be damaged when used for other than its intended purpose.  Learning which tool is best suited for a given task comes with experience.  The BUCK 124 is a very high quality knife.

rewrite.edit: This is a high quality knife and expensive.  It should not be used for hammering. An average hammer is cheap.
This knife is not intended to be used with a hammer and it may cause some damage despite the fact that this knife is of high quality.
This product is high quality and any tool can be damaged when its not used for the intended purpose. The average hammer is cheap and not as high quality as this item

qa_pair.question: With the aluminum pommel do you feel that you can hammer with this knife, or is it more of a collector's item. Expensive to put in a case.
qa_pair.answer: I wouldn't hammer with the pommel of any knife that's worth anything at all, and this certainly is a good knife.  I made the mistake of hammering in tent stakes with the brass pommel of a Buck Ranger a long time ago.  I put dings in the brass and I always regretted it.  Use a rock if nothing else.  Don't pry with a knife, either.  I've seen them with tips broken off.  People who abuse their knives don't appreciate them!

qa_pair.question: With the aluminum pommel do you feel that you can hammer with this knife, or is it more of a collector's item. Expensive to put in a case.
qa_pair.answer: No it's not for hammering. But it's one of the best knife I have, I use it for all my hunting trips. It would also make a  great survival knife........

qa_pair.question: With the aluminum pommel do you feel that you can hammer with this knife, or is it more of a collector's item. Expensive to put in a case.
qa_pair.answer: They don't make hammers out of aluminum for a reason.   If the tang extended beyond the aluminum it would be a different story.  You'll just end up ruining your knife.

qa_pair.question: With the aluminum pommel do you feel that you can hammer with this knife, or is it more of a collector's item. Expensive to put in a case.
qa_pair.answer: Hi! To , answer your question, if I need to use, this awesome Buck , in the woods , the city . I can count on this Bad,Boy . Yes it's strong enough to Hammer . But believe me .you are going to baby , this Buck . Later .

qa_pair.question: With the aluminum pommel do you feel that you can hammer with this knife, or is it more of a collector's item. Expensive to put in a case.
qa_pair.answer: I would definitely say this knife is a workhorse. Pretty enough to put in a case, sure. But definitely ready to get to work and be used in rough applications. It can take quite a beating. I would hesitate for a second to use the pommel as a hammer. It's most certainly a hunter's knife! Hope that helps.

qa_pair.question: With the aluminum pommel do you feel that you can hammer with this knife, or is it more of a collector's item. Expensive to put in a case.
qa_pair.answer: I agree 100% with the previous responders.  It is a very strong knife, but everytime I looked at it later, I would regret that I had abused it.  I own a variety of knives, and respectfully recomend that you consider the Gerber Silver Trident.  It has a flat stainless steel pommel [MADE FOR POUNDING] and a special grip material that absorbs the impacts.  If you want a high quality, heavy duty ,American made knife that was also DESIGNED to be used as a hammer, it would be hard to beat the Silver Trident.  Both knives are of very high quality and can usually be found similarily priced.

qa_pair.question: what are the standard lofts of clubs built into e12?
qa_pair.answer: It does not work that way!  it measures the ball speed as it passes the monitor.  So you chose 6 iron and hit 6 iron. It tracks all your shots against your 6 iron.  It does not know the loft of your 6 iron.

qa_pair.question: what are the standard lofts of clubs built into e12?
qa_pair.answer: I'm not sure of the stand lofts built in, but it's all crap anyway because there is no loft angle built into the gizmo. It only tracks ball speed. As such, if you miss hit the ball, it gives a completely bogus distance. This machine is junk. Do not buy it. I returned mine within a week or two. Even on perfect hits, it was not accurate compared to my rangefinder that is very accurate.

summary: This product will give you fully accurate reads on the speed and distance of the ball while it measures the speed and tracks shot against six irons but does not know the loft of the six irons. The product does not support a multiuser interface or contain a camera or device to record but can be used with Google-based apps from the Google Play Store. This product does not require the ball to travel far and measures when it passes through the radar to calculate the speed, and as such, would not be good for indoor use.

qa_pair.question: How does it install on the gun?
qa_pair.answer: You remove the factory rear slide plate, which is very easy to do. Then you install the clipdraw rear slide plate, which has two small screw holes. Once the new plate is on you simply use two of the supplied small screws to attach the actual clip piece. It screws on securely and is very durable. Overall, it's about a five minute installation.

qa_pair.question: How does it install on the gun?
qa_pair.answer: Instructions are straight forward and easy, everything necessary for install is included. You pop off the slide end piece then install the supplied one with the tapped/threaded holes. There is one spring you must watch closely so it doesn't get away, but other than that it's easy. I like the clip and it keeps my mod 27 in place.

qa_pair.question: How does it install on the gun?
qa_pair.answer: It is very simple. You take of the back piece and replace it with the one they give you. Just be careful when U remove the plastic end piece because there is a spring that could fly out. Once you get it off replace the new piece by pushing down on the spring and replace the new end cap. Screw in the clip( u could use removable lock tight on the screws) and you R done. It works nice with or without a holster. Go on U Tube and someone will have it on there.

You can also replace the trap taxi tires with pneumatic tires also available from Harbor Freight.

qa_pair.answer: The holes do not line up. What I done was take a piece of 3/4 exterior plywood, cut it the size I wanted, Paint it with exterior paint, drill holes and put bolts through holes on frame, then set the trap on the plywood, mark and drill and put bolts through to hold it to the plywood. I had to turn it a little to make it fit right but it works great.

I usually pump in an extra pound past what I wanted to set the pressure at, just to be sure.  This is a great pump, and far cheaper than the factory charges for the same identical pump!

qa_pair.question: Will this work on the back (main) shock? have a Jamis w/Fox shock...reg. air hose is too big & leaks when used, need something smaller/precise.
qa_pair.answer: Hi.I use this pump to adjust the air suspension on my H-D Ultra Limited, so I am not sure how it will work in other applications. This is a great pump for the way I use it. It has a short hose and a no-leak head (the part that attaches to the Schrader valve) that keeps the air in when attaching and removing. The short hose works well for me since the Schrader valve is located in a very tight location - between the frame and the left saddlebag. Even with my big fingers, I can easily attach and remove the hose.I hope these comments help.

qa_pair.question: how many pistols can this hold? is there open space in the middle or does it have small compartments?
qa_pair.answer: It is designed for two pistols in two zippered compartments on either side of the bag.  There is a large center compartment, velcro dividers are included and I put them in to keep my ear and eye protection in place on the ends then I use the center for ammo.  For me taking two guns to my local indoor range this is a perfect range bag.  I saw it at a local gun shop so I knew what I was getting when I ordered it.  Don't over think it, for the price you can't go wrong.

qa_pair.question: how many pistols can this hold? is there open space in the middle or does it have small compartments?
qa_pair.answer: Each side has a pocket the full length with a removable padded pocket inside. I can store 1  3-4 inch barrel gun in each side with room left over. The middle of the bag is divided into two compartments I fit hearing protection and other items in one half of the bag and a bunch of 50 rd ammo boxes In the other half.

qa_pair.question: how many pistols can this hold? is there open space in the middle or does it have small compartments?
qa_pair.answer: Two pistols nicely held. Large open space with adjustable velcro divider. I use mine back and forth to the range.

qa_pair.question: How many handguns can it carry if I also take 4 boxes of ammo, ear protection, targets & speed loader + other small items?  Are there 2 ext. pouches?
qa_pair.answer: The bag is designed for two pistols. Friday I went to the range with this bag. I carried a Sig P226 in one pistol pocket and a S&W; Model 41 in the other. Inside I had my full size ear muffs, shooting glasses, a speed loader, two boxes of 9mm rounds and two boxes of 22 rounds, a Blackhawk holster for the Sig, and a two mag belt pouch. I also had a cleaning cloth, small bottle of gun oil, a protein bar and some foam ear plugs. The bag was full but nothing was squashed. Had I put the holster on before going I could have easily gotten a couple more boxes of 9mm ammo in the bag.

qa_pair.question: How many handguns can it carry if I also take 4 boxes of ammo, ear protection, targets & speed loader + other small items?  Are there 2 ext. pouches?
qa_pair.answer: The reason i purchased it because it hangs on the rear of my wheel chair and clears the tires. I carry 1 full size 9mm and 1 nano w/poutchs on one side and 1 full sized 9mm and a kel tec pf9 on the other side. Eye/ear protection 3- spare mags ea. leatherman tool , mag speed loader, 1 soft and 1 hard holster and 4 boxes ammo in the center. I could pack more be can't carry it with a walking cane. The only thing i wish it had would be mag poutchs but it does have the mole strapes on the out side. It does come with a shoulder or wheel chair strape. I would recamend this to anyone. Happy shooting.

qa_pair.question: How many handguns can it carry if I also take 4 boxes of ammo, ear protection, targets & speed loader + other small items?  Are there 2 ext. pouches?
qa_pair.answer: Fits two large pistols, one in each outter pocket. Both outside pockets have removable padding for them. Could probably fit more if you were careful. Plenty of room in the large middle pocket for eyes, ears, ammo, and any other goodies

qa_pair.question: How many handguns can it carry if I also take 4 boxes of ammo, ear protection, targets & speed loader + other small items?  Are there 2 ext. pouches?
qa_pair.answer: There are 2 external zippered end-pouches that are app 10'' deep /8''wide about the size for a large binocular case.  I carry my handguns separately but I think you will get all that stuff in the bag.  I am happy with it.

qa_pair.question: How many handguns can it carry if I also take 4 boxes of ammo, ear protection, targets & speed loader + other small items?  Are there 2 ext. pouches?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, two exterior pouches. Definitely 2 guns. Depending on their size possibly 2 in each side. If they have some type of protection against bumping each other. The side pockets run the length of the bag so it's a pretty good size. The included gun sleeves are pretty thin. But would protect the guns from rubbing together.

summary: This bag comes with an adjustable shoulder strap. The bag has a life time warranty. This bag comes with two removable pistol rugs on each side. The dimensions of this product are 16 x 8 x 9 inches. The weight of the bag is 1.9 pounds. The zippers in the middle and on both sides can be locked. This bag can hold multiple pistols. The compartments are divided with a flap and a velcro connection, so you can use it with or without compartments.

qa_pair.question: how do you load the gun?
qa_pair.answer: loading is simple. The pistol has a magazine clip that is inserted up from the bottom of the pistol grip - much like the real P-38 Pistol. I can insert at least 15 BBs into the clip then insert the clip back into the pistol grip. The magazine is secured by a latch at the bottom of the pistol grip. You can see the latch in the photo of the pistol, at the bottom of the grip. One important thing to remember is to use ONLY copper plated BBs. If you use anything else, the gun may jam.

qa_pair.question: What is the liquid inside?  Is it toxic if the plastic breaks?
qa_pair.answer: The liquid is a sodium acetate super solution. It's got so much solid dissolved that it looks for a trigger to recrystallize  -  that releases heat. The trigger is the disc contained in the pack. To answer the question, sodium acetate is the acidic salt that's used to flavor "vinegar and salt" potato chips.

qa_pair.question: Is this considered a holographic sight? Is there a difference in reflex and holographic?
qa_pair.answer:
A holographic sight uses a pulse generator to beam the laser onto the glass. Millions of times a second. Your point of aim will shift with your eye movement and help facilitate both eyes open shooting. Can run into $7-800.00 for a truly good one. The sightmark is a red dot or "reflex" sight in that the laser is focused in one spot on the pane of glass. As with all things everyone has their preferences. For the price, the sightmark is a heck of  a deal. Good lock for the scope rail decent illumination through the lens and light weight and compact. They will also take a beating. Mine is mounted on a .357 magnum. It's gone through hundreds of rounds with no sign of a defect. Bottom line is price and the application the sight will be used for. Just target shooting you certainly don't need a trijicon or eotech. Jumping out of airplanes or storming castles... different scenario. Hope I've been of assistance.
